pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.0: 85. The training rule on entering a village at the wrong time
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.3: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.4: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the village at the wrong time, sat down in the public meeting hall, and talked about all sorts of pointless things:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.5: about kings, thieves, and officials; about armies, dangers, and battles; about food, drink, clothes, and beds; about garlands and perfumes; about relatives, vehicles, villages, towns, and countries; about women and heroes; about streets and wells; about the departed; about various trivialities; about the world and the sea; about being this or that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.7: “How can the Sakyan ascetics enter the village at the wrong time, sit down in the public meeting hall, and talk about such pointless things?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.9: They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.10: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.11: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.12: “How can the monks from the group of six enter the village at the wrong time, sit down in the public meeting hall, and talk about such pointless things?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.15: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.20: Foolish men, how can you enter the village at the wrong time, sit down in the public meeting hall, and talk about such pointless things?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.23: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.24: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.26: ‘If a monk enters a village at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:1.1.27: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.2: Soon afterwards a number of monks were walking through the Kosalan country toward Sāvatthī when one evening they came to a certain village.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.6: But knowing that entering a village at the wrong time had been prohibited by the Master and being afraid of wrongdoing, they declined.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.8: They then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.9: who in turn told the Master.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.10: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.11: “Monks, I allow you to enter a village at the wrong time after informing someone.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.12: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.14: ‘If a monk, without informing anyone, enters a village at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:2.1.15: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.2: Soon afterwards a monk was walking through the Kosalan country toward Sāvatthī when one evening he came to a certain village.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.6: But knowing that entering a village at the wrong time without informing anyone had been prohibited by the Master and being afraid of wrongdoing, he declined.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.8: He then went to Sāvatthī and told the monks what had happened,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.9: who in turn told the Master.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.10: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.11: “Monks, I allow you to enter a village at the wrong time after informing an available monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.12: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.14: ‘If a monk, when another monk is available, enters a village at the wrong time without informing him, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:3.1.15: In this way the Master laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.2: Soon afterwards a monk was bitten by a snake.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.3: Another monk went to the village to get fire.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.5: that the Master has prohibited entering a village at the wrong time without informing an available monk. And being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not enter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.7: Soon afterwards the Master gave a teaching and addressed the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.8: “Monks, I allow you to enter a village at the wrong time without informing an available monk if there is some appropriate urgent business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.9: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:4.1.10: ‘If a monk, when another monk is available, enters a village at the wrong time without informing him, unless there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.6: he is able to inform and then enter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.8: he is not able to inform and then enter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.10: when the middle of the day has passed, until dawn.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.12: if he crosses the boundary of an enclosed village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.13: If he enters the vicinity of an unenclosed village, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.14: Unless there is some appropriate urgent business:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.1.15: except if there is some appropriate urgent business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.1: If it is the wrong time, and he perceives it as the wrong time, and he enters a village without informing an available monk, unless there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.2: If it is the wrong time, but he is unsure if it is, and he enters a village without informing an available monk, unless there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.3: If it is the wrong time, but he perceives it as the right time, and he enters a village without informing an available monk, unless there is some appropriate urgent business, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.4: If it is the right time, but he perceives it as the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.5: If it is the right time, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.2.6: If it is the right time, and he perceives it as the right time, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.2: if there is some appropriate urgent business;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.3: if he enters after informing an available monk;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.4: if he enters without informing when there is no available monk;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.5: if he is going between monasteries;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.6: if he is going to the dwelling place of nuns;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.7: if he is going to the dwelling place of ascetics of another sect;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.8: if he is returning to the monastery;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.9: if the road goes via a village;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.12: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc85:5.3.13: The third rule, the training rule on entering a village at the wrong time, is finished.
